website_summaries.verdict: Super easy release with minimal twisting. If sheer production is a priority, a few sets of these affordable trays will make a lot of ice at one time.
pros: Overall quality and design is comparable to higher-end models, yet the cost is lower
cons: Some plastic residue can leach into water
Larger tray size may not fit in smaller freezers

customer_reviews.title: Need ICE without getting deported? Buy these trays.
customer_reviews.text: Oh man.... look at what I’ve become. Here i am, reviewing an ice cube tray on Amazon. Looks like I better finish my glass of bourbon before I get started- Heyyyyyyyyy so uhh.. these ice cube trays are pretty sweet man. Legit though, they’re just some good ol’ fashion ice cube trays. Did i mention they make ice!!??!? But don’t be fooled, they require a freezer to perform the freezing operation. All jokes aside, once these bad boys have the solid form of water in them, all you have to do is give them a little opposite bend from each side and voila!! Frickin ice cubes babyyyy. Perfect for people who like their drinks extra cold...because it’s ice. Yeah.
customer_reviews.author: CMANLEYSPY

customer_reviews.title: Good but Rubbermaid is better
customer_reviews.text: I bought the and the rubbermaid version. These make a tiny bit bigger ice cubes but they are harder top get or off the trays. The plastic is harder in the trays than the rubbermaid. I bet the larger size cube combined with the harder plastic is what makes them harder to get out of the trays. As you can see on the photo (rubbermaid to the right in the photo) you could stack 5 rubbermaid trays in the same space that these trays can stack 4. Overall, I prefer the rubbermaid trays.
customer_reviews.author: Bayarea Girl

customer_reviews.title: Cracks and buy if you like de-icing your freezer.
customer_reviews.text: I would give these 0 stars if I could. After a year, 3 out of the 4 had multiple cracks. The water leak is slow but fast enough that I had a thick layer of ice at the bottom of my freezer. If I thought defrosting my work fridge/freezer was a pain, it was nothing compared to the solid sheet that I had to melt to make my freezer clean again. Thankfully I saved my old dollar store trays. They never cracked so I put them back into use until I can try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Marie C

customer_reviews.title: that the cubes shatter into fine pieces when breaking out
customer_reviews.text: Two of the four trays work as expected. Water freezes into ice, and the cubes pop out with a gentle twist. The other two are another story, however. On these two trays the ice sticks firmly to the plastic, and it takes more energy to break them free. The ice is adhered so well to the plastic, that the cubes shatter into fine pieces when breaking out, making them virtually useless. Very strange. We thought this would go away with subsequent washings, but it seems to be a property of the plastic itself. How do you mess up an ice tray?
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best ice trays I've used.  Takes office abuse, not brittle, and easy to get the ice out.
customer_reviews.text: When i tell you these are the best cheapo ice trays I've ever used, i mean it. I have used a lot of icetrays,and most of them become brittle in a matter of weeks or months. I have had these for a long time. In an office setting they get used a lot. To this day they are not brittle, the still pop ice out with a easy twist. My 5 year old can do it that's how easy the ice comes out. If you're looking for super sheap and super good ice trays, you need to look no farther.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Ballz

customer_reviews.title: REALLY PLEASED WITH THESE!
customer_reviews.text: ''Really pleased with these trays. No complaints so far. If that changes I will certainly update this. * Every ice cube comes out of the tray every single time. Exactly what I was looking for. Really pleased with these. * Not too flexible or stiff plastic either one. Easy to manipulate. Bottom of cubes are rounded, something I think contributes to them being so easy to remove. ** One tip with these is to not overfill them. If you do, you might have a harder time breaking them apart and may end up with some uneven sized cubes. If you have any questions leave them in the comments and I will be happy to answer.
customer_reviews.author: @Lark

customer_reviews.title: *NOT* Stackable
customer_reviews.text: Ice trays are pretty basic and pretty hard to mess up. I've got to rate this one star because these trays are not stackable. If you fill them to the standard level, the trays will stick to each other. This is a huge pain in the butt and presents sanitary hazards. The ad explicit says: "STACKABLE: Trays stack easily and neatly in the freezer without sticking to each other " That ad is full of lies. This is another case where I think the positive reviews are fake because these are just poorly designed cheap plastic trays.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: Bad product!! Came with holes in it! I bought 3 packs of them and only one tray had no holes, the whole stuff went to garbage
customer_reviews.author: Flo

customer_reviews.title: Not really recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I finally used these the other day & one of them broke when I was trying to get the ice out. It broke so much that I can’t even use it some of them. It broke down the middle of the try to the point that you can’t put water in any of them to make use. I just had to throw it away. But the other one was fine.
customer_reviews.author: MR. & MR. Neff

customer_reviews.title: They look good - but crack.
customer_reviews.text: I will definitely not buy these again, in less than 3 months they started getting small cracks, leaking water in the freezer. They looked like their high quality, what a waste of money, I may have to go back to the old school metal ones, if I can find them.
customer_reviews.author: J. G.

customer_reviews.title: Good price and works well
customer_reviews.text: I actually ordered these thinking they were the Rubbermaid trays I have used for years. My experience has been that cheap trays are hard to empty and easy to break. These, however, worked quite well. We use a lot of ice so they are filled and emptied a couple of times each week and I have had no problem. They require only slightly more effort to empty than the Rubbermaid, but these are not the cheap trays that take a gorilla to twist and empty. Have used for several months and am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeva

customer_reviews.title: ... froze ice late made ice water first sip tasted like gas DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: These are toxic I received the trays and opened them up and right away got some weird silky/ sticky white stuff coming off them so I washed them and froze ice late made ice water first sip tasted like gas DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work just as expected.
customer_reviews.text: They do the job of creating ice cubes. They break out easily with a quick little twist of the tray. All come out the first time. Gonna order another pair for when these finally wear out. Hopefully another year or more. They asked me to rate the features. Easy to remove, check, Easy to use, check and then warmth. What the heck does warmth mean. It's an an ice tray, it's not suppose to get warm.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Good. solid ice cube trays!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved these ice cube trays... I needed sturdy trays to make cubes using coffee for a drink recipe. I purchased, because someone wrote in their review that they were stackable, so you could make two trays of ice without anything happening to the bottom tray, however, the bottom tray did not result in perfect ice cubes like the top one. If I use again, I'll put them in the freezer side by side and not stacked. Wish now that I had taken a photo... difficult to describe flawed ice on bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Meema of Eight

customer_reviews.title: This ice tray will leave small pieces of plastic in your water
customer_reviews.text: After several weeks of use, I noticed that the ice trays would leach plastic bits into the water (I've touched the pieces shown in the picture and they definitely feel like hard plastic). Not entirely sure what the mechanism is but I think the plastic is sticking to the ice cubes as they're being pulled out. Regardless, if you value your health and safety, I would avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Best ice trays ever
customer_reviews.text: No fighting to twist the tray enough to get the ice. These are shaped so that if nothing blocks the forming ice, it expands upward a little and the cubes all but fall from the tray when it is turned over. If something on top keeps the expansion from freezing from rising, the trays are flexible enough to twist easily. No more fighting to release cubes one at a time!
customer_reviews.author: Cary

customer_reviews.title: Good until they crack
customer_reviews.text: Good: These trays stack and they are inexpensive. Bad: They crack after 10 uses, leaking water into your freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Mojo Nixon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - No Drama
customer_reviews.text: I gave up on ice machines. went through 4 in 5 years. Tried silicon ice trays. Absolutely the worst for getting out of mold. I went back to these basic ice trays. I already had some. I barely have to do anything to get them to release the ice. I just turn them upside down and only have to twist a little to get the last 3 out. Sure I could use the fridge ice maker but I use istilled water for my cubes.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, old fashioned trays!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace the original-sized, old-style plastic ice cube trays I'd had for years that got left behind in the move, and I finally found them! They make nice, big ice cubes the way ice cubes are supposed to be. The blue ones make cubes that are smaller (very narrow and rounded on the bottom), and it takes a lot of them to make my fabulous frozen margaritas! These cubes fill a glass without having to use half the tray or more.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Ice cube nirvana
customer_reviews.text: Cubes pop out easily 90% of the time. (The other 10%? Acceptable collateral damage). The trays stack, so you can freeze lots and lots of cubes at once. Nice sized cubes. Neither iceberg monstrosities nor miniature snowflakes. Only used them for about 6 months, but they're holding up with no cracking.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and very affordable!
customer_reviews.text: These ice cube trays are great! I did a lot of research before finding these. They are priced very well, stackable like described and release the ice cubes easily without any worries the tray is going to break. I made sure to first make a batch of ice in each tray to discard, just in case there might be a transfer of a chemical smell from the plastic. The cubes are a good size. Not too big and not too small. I did have to crush them to put into my Swell bottle but not a big deal. I would recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Tina C.

customer_reviews.title: The tray bottoms will stick if over filled
customer_reviews.text: I replaced some of my 10 year old trays with these because of the 'non stick' hype. Funny thing is that the trays I replaced were identical to these. These are good quality ice cube trays. If you place one of these on a lower tray filled with liquid water, any part of that water in contact with the bottom of these will stick as it freezes. I call BS on the 'non stick' part. Other than that, good trays, good value.
customer_reviews.author: Ken MTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly acceptable Replacement Trays
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with these trays. They're not as good as the original ones that came with my refrigerator for two reasons: 1) the cubes have rounded bottoms rather than the more aesthetically pleasing squarish bottoms of my originals, and 2) when stacked in the freezer, the cubes in the tray underneath stick to the bottom of the one above and the cubes pull out of the bottom one and fall all over the place when you separate them. So you have to kind of slide them apart rather than pull. They could remedy this by putting some kind of ridge on the tray so the water in the bottom tray doesn't touch the top tray.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Five stars plus!
customer_reviews.text: After using a trusted name in plastic products for their ice cube trays for years, I was disappointed at how they were difficult to release the ice cubes, how often ice would remain in the tray, and how quickly they cracked causing leaks. My search for replacement trays led me to these. What an improvement! Cubes release very easily without partial cubes and chips remaining in the tray. No need to run these under water for them to release. Five stars plus!!
customer_reviews.author: Garden Cat

customer_reviews.title: Stick with Rubbermaid
customer_reviews.text: We keep a number of ice trays in our deep freezer for filling our cooler for boating on the weekends. These worked great for about 4 batches of ice and then they started breaking. The plastic is super thin. They seemed like a good choice by cost, but you get what you pay for. I'll stick with Rubbermaid trays from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Schweiss

customer_reviews.title: Ice cube  trays
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set of ice cub trays because my ice make was not working properly and I needed to make ice. When I saw this set on Amazon I know I had to purchase it. The set reminded me of the kind of ice trays we used growing up. The trays are BPA free and the ice cubes are easily released with a quick flick of the wrist. I have not used them yet because I got my ice maker working again. These are a backup if and when the ice maker goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie 68

customer_reviews.title: Makes nice square ice cubes! Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: These Ice Trays work great! You fill them with water, put them in the freezer and you have ICE!!! I’ve have had no trouble with them at all. They are very simple to twist to crack the ice, and get all the ice to fall out. What I have liked the best so far is that all the ice cracks and falls out without some of the ice sticking and needing a second twist where the ice breaks up! We’ll see if this stays this way, I will keep my fingers crossed. I would recommend these ice trays! I would buy these again my self!
customer_reviews.author: Lori From Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Small cracks only after a month
customer_reviews.text: Good size ice cubes, made in USA, and releases ice easily. I’m very pleased with this purchase. My old ice cube tray looks wimpy compared to these big trays!! UPDATE: Every time I filled my trays I noticed water pooling in my freezer. Upon further inspection, these trays have small cracks snd holes that allow water to escape and make a huge mess in your freezer. My return window already passed so I guess I’ll be throwing these out.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ver

customer_reviews.title: They Work
customer_reviews.text: I don't expect much out of ice cube trays, because their only purpose is to hold water before it freezes. I didn't want fancy trays, I just wanted something that worked. These trays have met and exceeded all expectations. They are made of a thick and sturdy plastic that I don't see breaking down anytime soon. My previous ice cube trays cracked and became useless within 4 months of occasional use. They do make large ice cubes, which was a happy surprise for me. TL;DR They hold water!
customer_reviews.author: Megan C

customer_reviews.title: My ice taste like plastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the great reviews everyone had but chewing on the ice made from these trays taste like plastic damn sh!$$y deal for expensive ice cube trays. Wish I would have known this I would not bought them. Now i am stuck with this plastic tasting making ice cube trays
customer_reviews.author: a.s.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Pros: + Good (medium) size + 4 of them; I only use 2 at a time, but this is great in case some break or are in the wash, using for chocolate making, etc + Twisting the tray to release ice cubs is way easier than silicone push molds (in my opinion) Cons: - Have warped slightly over time; does nothing to affect product usability, but it is noticeable - No covers, so they will evaporate over time if you don't use them fast enough
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Easy to Remove Ice
customer_reviews.text: In a review I read, someone said these were silicone. No they are not. They are a durable plastic. Ice is easily releasing from the trays with a single twist. Cubes are of a good size and lasts longer and are larger than the cubes the refrigerator ice maker produces. It's temporarily out of commission which is why I bought these. Not sure why the Rate Features section includes "warmth". Doesn't make sense with ice cube trays.
customer_reviews.author: Sevaron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect if you don't have a lot of room. They are the old fashioned easy to use ones. Just fill, freeze and twist slightly, and you have the perfect cube that can be put anywhere in the freezer with zip lock bags.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Wise

customer_reviews.title: Best Cube Trays
customer_reviews.text: Ice maker went out and decided not to replace it because I did not like the stale ice it made anyway. Got one of these sets as a mothers day present. They work so well I bought the wife two more. I like the bigger cubes compared to fridge ice-makers. Also, most of the cube is clear meaning it is pure ice. Unlike the white ice you get from ice-makers. This means less gas bubbles and longer lasting ice.
customer_reviews.author: Mike The Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and strong. Def worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great ice tray! Very durable and strong. I bought from ice trays from the dollar store recently and they snapped when I tried to get the ice out. I bought this set because it’s bigger than a regular ice tray and seemed to be made of a thicker material. I’m very happy with the quality. These will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Glover

customer_reviews.title: They spill if you are not careful
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my aging, cracked ice cube trays with these ice cube trays. I wish I hadn't. The ice cube trays have no side to side channels for water to travel sideways in the tray, so they spill when adjusting water levels from side to side. (Not a problem when filling them from the sink, but I fill mine using bottled water, and they spill on the floor a lot). The cubes are smaller than my old ice cube trays, so I have to refill the trays more frequently. I am searching for better ice cube trays to replace these ice cube trays.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Layne

customer_reviews.title: BEST ICE TRAYS OUT THERE!!
customer_reviews.text: Writing a review about ice trays seems a bit odd, but I have to say. I am an ice snob. I have to have a full bin of ice and I don't have an ice maker. I have tried every ice tray out there on the market and have had issues with them all. Ice won't come out unless I wet the bottom of the trays, or the ones where you push them out with your thumbs needs way more strength than I have. These trays Are The Best! Over filled, under filled the cubes pop out with no effort at all. Finally, my daily ice chores are now a breeze... YES...BUY THESE TRAYS!
customer_reviews.author: Jodee

customer_reviews.title: Food Grade, Stackable, and Dishwasher Safe
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for trays to freeze pumpkin and other frozen treats for my dog, and wanted them to be FDA-approved and food grade, which these are. The trays are stackable and dishwasher safe. One 15 ounce can of pumpkin is more than enough for 1 tray, filled to the top. The contents are easily released from the tray with a twist or two. I've also used these for small portions of frozen fruit, and have seen in other reviews that they work well with baby food. The trays are excellent value for the money, and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ice Trays. No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I like these ice trays although they are noticeably slower in making ice than other plastic trays I have had in the past. I use a good deal of ice so I make full use of all four trays on a daily basis. They trays release the cubes readily and are easily cleaned in the dishwasher. when they arrived, they had a slight chemical odor but a quick pass through the dishwasher and that vanished. I am satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Perry M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cubes pop right out
customer_reviews.text: Invert the tray of ice cubes, give it a twist, and the cubes drop out. Our ice maker bit the dust, so just fill it up with cubes from the trays and it dispenses the cubes. Not as convenient as the ice maker, but for the price of four trays compared to the cost of having the ice maker repaired/replaced, it's a tremendous bargain!
customer_reviews.author: chief jd

customer_reviews.title: easy release, stack nicely
customer_reviews.text: these trays release the ice easily right out of the freezer without running water over them. They also stack properly without the top tray contacting the water in the bottom tray. Of course, these trays will probably crack after a year or two, most of them seem to always fail eventually. I'll just buy another set.
customer_reviews.author: Waddie

customer_reviews.title: easy ejecting ice trays
customer_reviews.text: My major thing with ice cube trays is: are they easy to empty of their ice? Yes, these pop the ice right out and you can easily pick out just a few cubes if you want to. The curve at the bottom of the cube is just right for easy ice ejection and whatever type of plastic this is, it is flexible right out of the freezer. Seems durable. I bought extra for freezing my homemade chicken bone broth.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Spellin

customer_reviews.title: They’re ok
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two packs of these for freezing my homemade beef & chicken stock and homemade raw cat food. They are quite sturdy, easy to clean and the cubes are good sized. Each cube holds 1-1.25 oz, so I love being able to easily measure kitty’s food. However, cubes don’t release very easily and the plastic on the bottom digs into my hands when twisting....have to wear gloves when releasing to prevent my hands from being sore. Also, they aren’t designed to stack within each other so they take up a lot of space when storing.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Vineyard

customer_reviews.title: Makes nice ice
customer_reviews.text: When I initially received these trays I was slightly dismayed because they felt flimsy compared to the ancient kitchen aid trays I’ve been using. But they work exactly as expected, and the ice is easier to remove. Ice pops out with a slight twist, and perfectly formed without cracking or shattering. And best of all, no BPA! Would be even better if made from 100% recycled materials.
customer_reviews.author: AKA AK

customer_reviews.title: Cubes remove easily without cracking tray
customer_reviews.text: These ice cube trays work terrific, discharging cubes easily without sticking. Sounds simple enough, but I have bought numerous sets of trays the last couple of years and had cracks after removing cubes, the last set by a different manufacturer only lasted a couple months. These seem to be well made and are reasonably priced. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Joenpb

customer_reviews.title: Finally, ice cube trays that work!
customer_reviews.text: After buying two sets of ice cube trays, one at BB&B and another on Amazon from that big brand in rubber products, I was frustrated that all the trays shattered within weeks to a few months of normal use (when twisting them to remove the cubes). I used to have trays for years without an issue, so clearly it seems some places have switched to cheaper plastics in their products. But so far these trays have been great and the ice cubes have come out easily.
customer_reviews.author: LA Writer

customer_reviews.title: just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Lots of ice cubes, easy to freeze so very efficient energy since the cubes freeze quickly. Very simple and useful 'old school' cube trays. would absolutely reorder.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Holds ice while it freezes, lets go of it when you twist
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all, basically. These seem to be thicker than my former set (which is great, because the old set cracked from use). The ice freezes. When I twist to release the ice, the ice comes out pretty easily. It seems that it releases the ice slightly more easily because the plastic is thicker and stiffer, so the tray is less twisty.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: You can't stack them wrong. :)
customer_reviews.text: I love these ice trays because I never have to store unused trays. The trays that nest are great if you need that, but I find the nesting feature frustrating when all I want is to refill my trays and put them in the freezer without spills. And these are nice size ice cubes too. Finding joy in small things!
customer_reviews.author: BethStLouis

customer_reviews.title: Great all around general use ice cube trays
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty much exactly the same as my old ice cube trays, and I am very happy with them so far! They are large, have a lot of cells, seem sturdy, and are easy to clean. They didn't cost much either. I use them to freeze large batches of pureed food for our babies, then for ice in the meantime!
customer_reviews.author: CaptainBlackton

customer_reviews.title: Who needs an ice maker?
customer_reviews.text: The dedicated ice machine in my refrigerator broke after about 8 years and instead of hiring someone to repair it, I simply turned the water off to the fridge and removed it. I replaced it with four of these ice cube trays. They make nice big ice cubes, are easy to fill, stack really well and the ice cubes slide easily from their places when the time comes to empty them. I don't miss the ice machine at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H. Rosengarten

customer_reviews.title: Ice trays the way it should be
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and well designed. Does exactly what it’s supposed to, and even has a few extra features. The handles on the sides are great for when you need to twist the tray for removal and there are even little feet which help with stacking neatly in the freezer, quality of plastic seemed great as well as all of the ice popped out immediately with 1 try.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Makes Ice, Doesn't Break, A+
customer_reviews.text: I needed new ice cube trays. In the past I have had plastic trays like these break when you try to get the ice out, but this one doesn't. Something about the way it is made makes the ice come out way before you have to bend the tray. I put them in the dishwasher and they are fine. I am confident they will be fine until I inevitably forget them in the freezer of this rental home when I move out.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great for makeup storage too!!
customer_reviews.text: Great price and well made. These aren’t just for ice cubes!!! Call me crazy, but I’m not actually using these for ice cubes. I read on Pinterest, that you can actually use ice cube trays as a storage container for eye shadow pots. These fit my ColourPop and MAC eyeshadows perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: Trustworthy, Effective & Loyal
customer_reviews.text: I granted these two ice cube trays their freedom but they decided to stay. We have grown too close. No longer is there a master-servant relationship. Nay, we are friends.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Easy removal of ice
customer_reviews.text: Best ice trays ever!! No more banging on my granite countertops! Every morning my sons before school get ice and bang it on the countertops to fill their water bottles for the day. It drove me bananas! Then my one son banged on the ice tray so hard it cracked in half. Since these new ones I been having a peaceful morning! Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Prime

customer_reviews.title: Cubes taste like plastic!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried washing these numerous times and soaking them in dish soap, and the ice cubes continue to taste toxic like plastic off-gassing. It is horribly disappointing, as the ice cubes pop out nicely.
customer_reviews.author: TashaD

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Finally an ice tray that removes the ice cubes with ease. They are just like I use to have, before the days of auto ice makers. Recently, we have tried several types, including silicone, and was a disaster to pry open. But these surpass them all. Seriously, they work.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Pearson

customer_reviews.title: I’m reviewing an ice tray, they must be good
customer_reviews.text: Both durable and easy to use— the ice comes out with little effort and the plastic doesn’t crack. I literally purchased three other brands in the last few months and was left baffled and how poorly they were all constructed and how difficult it was to remove the ice. I seriously considered constructing my own and applying for Shark Tank. Thankfully, I found these.
customer_reviews.author: Natashia WithanEye

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't know it to look at them, but...
customer_reviews.text: It's surprising. They look just like the hard to use Dollar Store ones that I am replacing. When they arrived, I was disappointed. BUT... when I used them I found that they were exactly what I wanted. The ice cubes release with ease. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Evans

customer_reviews.title: Slightly more money than others, but sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: These have been great so far. Only negative thing is the price. They are a bit more expensive than the "el cheapo" thin plastic trays, but these are thicker plastic and seem better made so I guess it's worth the few extra $$. At least I hope so. Seems that way so far.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: High Quality. Never been this happy for ice trays.
customer_reviews.text: Really good ice trays. From the moment I opened them they seemed really high quality and had a bit of flex to them to allow for cracking the ice. They are a nice white color that doesn't look like cheap plastic. I would definitely recommend you get these and replace those old ones you have
customer_reviews.author: Travis Simon

customer_reviews.title: No smell. No freezer burn taste.
customer_reviews.text: My wife had purchased some at the dollar store. After a while they started to smell funny and made the ice taste unpleasant. These are well made. Easy to get the ice out, stackable and most importantly, they don't make the ice taste and/or smell weird. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar G.

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what its supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me and hate the normal crescent moon shape ice that conforms to the shape of cups blocking you from drinking it then this is perfect. Fill up these things every couple days and you've got tons of ice. I was worried my refrigerator wouldn't be able to dispense this lare ice shape, but it worked perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Durable trays
customer_reviews.text: Really durable trays. I used them when the ice maker in my fridge went out. Much cheaper than getting a new ice maker. The cube size is larger than the ones from the old blue flexible trays I used to use, and I like it better. I have a new fridge now, but I keep these trays for freezing lemon and lime juice. Really handy when you need fresh juice in recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use ice cubes
customer_reviews.text: My wife just had surgery and we are going through a huge amount of ice. Way more than our ice maker can keep up with. I had some silicone ice cube trays that make nice square ice cubes, but man are they a pain to remove. These easy release ice cube trays have been a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Tall Bill

customer_reviews.title: Ice Cube would approve..
customer_reviews.text: I saw a lot of reviews with people complaining these ice cube trays were cheap and inafficient. I took the risk anyways and these trays are perfect! They make the perfect sized cubes. The trays themselves seem very sturdy as well. When Ice Cube the rapper was born, I am fairly certain he came from these trays.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ice trays
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted some plain, hard-plastic ice trays and that’s what these are. If you fill the tray all the way up the cubes are pretty big, which I prefer because I typically throw a few in a Yeti tumbler and they’ll last all day without watering down your drink. If you wanted smaller cubes just don’t fill the tray up as much.
customer_reviews.author: BFD

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you don't overfill
customer_reviews.text: My through-the-door icemaker and dispenser no longer works in my double door fridge, but the ice cubes made in these trays can be dispensed ok. It's a little effort to make ice and dump them into my container to be dispensed, but a whole lot cheaper than buying a new fridge. BTW, the through-the-door dispenser seems to be the first thing to fail, statistically.
customer_reviews.author: ed q

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to remove
customer_reviews.text: It says ‘easy to remove’. Mine was not so easy to remove, have to call husband every single time just to remove the ice as it is very hard and not flexible. Will be switching to silicon ice trays
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Reviews of excellent are right on
customer_reviews.text: Best ice trays I have ever seen. We moved into a condo and there were some ice cube trays there. We used them but when you stacked them up they tipped over and the water ran all over the place. So we bought six of these. They are awesome like the reviews that i read. Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy use, and extremely affordable!
customer_reviews.text: Finally!! I found some great ice trays!! I had purchased a silicone tray set, and couldn’t have been more disappointed with them. Unlike the silicone tray, these Kitch trays are so easy to use! Frozen cubes release so easily, unlike the silicone trays (which were either breaking my nails or bruising the palms of my hands when trying to dump the cubes). The trays make a large number of cubes and are stackable too! These Kitch trays are made of great quality and should last for a very long time. I just recommended them to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: What you need in a regular ice tray
customer_reviews.text: They stack neatly, they make decent cubes, and they're easy to clean. What else is there to say about a basic ice cube tray? I use these to make the ice for mixing drinks in a shaker, then use fancier ice cubes for serving. So having a neat stack in the corner of my freezer makes it so I never have to worry about running out of ice in the middle of a party.
customer_reviews.author: James Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps I was confused, but I thought each pack ...
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I was confused, but I thought each pack had two ice trays. So two packs would give me four ice trays (like the picture). I only received one pack with two ice trays. Just wanted to clarify for others. Nothing fancy, they are two white ice trays.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole C J Young

customer_reviews.title: JUST in Time...
customer_reviews.text: These BPA Free Ice Cube Trays are simply Wonder~Full and Superbly Made. Honestly I was amazed that I received FOUR for this price compared to what I could purchase at other stores. I LOVE these trays and am in Love with the ease of use {don't fill quite up to the top and the ice removal is much easier} and with the price... Wowza and Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Carmel and Savona Creators of The Finger Gloves(tm)

customer_reviews.title: Unusable Trays
customer_reviews.text: All of the trays had a hole in them, in the exact location. Clearly a manufacturing defect!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Winston

customer_reviews.title: Great for baby food
customer_reviews.text: I bought these trays as baby food storage. I make baby food at home so I know exactly what my baby is eating and the ice cubes helps me with portion control. One ice cube is about one (1) oz. Works great and it cleans up really easily. I would have to buy more because my baby is growing too fast and I need to make more food...
customer_reviews.author: Katie D

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: Ice trays as I remember them as a kid. Great quality. A twist or two and the ice cubes pop loose. If they do get stuck, run some water quickly over the ice cubes and twist again. All good.
customer_reviews.author: C. Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Makes removing even ice, a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: The title sums it up: Easy release ice cubes, Years of frustration at trying to loosen ice cubes gone! With this, removing ice is a breeze. Four trays came in the pack so I am able to use a couple for freezing homemade pesto and stock and still have two left for ice. I highly recommend this and have already told all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Malm

customer_reviews.title: Easy stacking
customer_reviews.text: We have an older non-icemaking fridge so making ice is up to me along with the floors and windows. These ice trays stack easy and the ice cracks out with a sharp twist into our ice bin. The price and performance make it a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Kitch Easy Release White Ice Cube Tray, 16 Cube Trays (Pack of 4) (4 Pack - 64 Cubes)
feature_bullets: Made In The USA: Proudly made in the USA out of top quality food grade materials. Each purchase supports American industry and factory workers
Includes 4 Premium Ice Cube Trays! Each tray makes 16 nice-sized ice cubes for a total of 64
Flexible And Durable Ice Trays: Ice cubes release easily with just a twist
Stackable: Trays stack easily and neatly in the freezer without sticking to each other
Bpa Free And Dishwasher Safe: These Kitch Ice Trays are 100% BPA Free and safe to wash in the dishwasher

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars5,239 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
